Indicator: Years of Life Lost Before Age 75
dataSourceYear: Vital Statistics for Philadelphia, Pennsylvania Department of Health
chartComment: Years of Potential Life Lost Before Age 75 (YPLL-75) is an age-adjusted rate per 100,000 of the population. It is based on the average years a person would have lived if he or she had not died before age 75.
Central: The methods for calculating Years of Life Lost Before Age 75, previously called Premature Death, have been updated since prior reports.

Indicator: Life Expectancy in Years, Male
dataSourceYear: Vital Statistics for Philadelphia, Pennsylvania Department of Health
chartComment: Life expectancy at birth is the expected number of years to be lived by someone born at the time of calculation, if mortality at each age remains constant in the future.

Indicator: Life Expectancy in Years, Female
dataSourceYear: Vital Statistics for Philadelphia, Pennsylvania Department of Health
chartComment: Life expectancy at birth is the expected number of years to be lived by someone born at the time of calculation, if mortality at each age remains constant in the future.

Indicator: Poor or Fair Health
dataSourceYear: Public Health Management Corporation (PHMC) Household Health Survey
chartComment: Percentage of adults who rate their health as "fair" or "poor" in response to the question, "In general, would you say that your health is excellent, very good, good, fair, or poor?"
Central: Two years of Household Health Survey data (2012 and 2014/15) were combined to provide more reliable estimates by planning district, therefore these numbers are not directly comparable with previous estimates.

Indicator: Adult smoking Prevalence
dataSourceYear: Public Health Management Corporation (PHMC) Household Health Survey
chartComment: Percentage of adults who have smoked at least 100 cigarettes in their lifetime and currently smoke "every day" or "some days."
Central: Two years of Household Health Survey data (2012 and 2014/15) were combined to provide more reliable estimates by planning district, therefore these numbers are not directly comparable with previous estimates.

Indicator: Smoking-Attributable Mortality Rate per 100,000 People
dataSourceYear: Vital Statistics for Philadelphia, Pennsylvania Department of Health
chartComment: Age-adjusted rate of deaths attributable to smoking per 100,000 adults 35 years and older. This measure is based on CDC's Smoking-Attributable Mortality, Morbidity, and Economic Costs (SAMMEC).

Indicator: Adult Obesity Prevalence
dataSourceYear: Public Health Management Corporation (PHMC) Household Health Survey
chartComment: Percentage of adults with BMI greater than or equal to 30kg/m2, based on self-reported height and weight.
Central: Two years of Household Health Survey data (2012 and 2014/15) were combined to provide more reliable estimates by planning district, therefore these numbers are not directly comparable with previous estimates.

Indicator: Adults Drinking ?1 Sugary Drink Daily
dataSourceYear: Public Health Management Corporation (PHMC) Household Health Survey
chartComment: Percentage of adults who drank soda, sweetened fruit drinks, and/or bottled teas at least once a day for past 30 days. Respondents were instructed do not include diet soda/drinks.""
Central: Examples provided to respondents included Coke, 7-Up, Snapple, Hugs, lemonade, and Kool-Aid.

Indicator: Premature Cardiovascular Disease (CVD) Mortality Rate per 100,000 People
dataSourceYear: Vital Statistics for Philadelphia, Pennsylvania Department of Health
chartComment: Age-adjusted rate per 100,000 persons of CVD deaths to persons under 65 years of age.

Indicator: Adult Hypertension Prevalence
dataSourceYear: Public Health Management Corporation (PHMC) Household Health Survey
chartComment: Percentage of adults who have been told by a doctor or other health professional that they have high blood pressure or hypertension. Excludes respondents with a history of gestational hypertension only.
Central: Two years of Household Health Survey data (2012 and 2014/15) were combined to provide more reliable estimates by planning district, therefore these numbers are not directly comparable with previous estimates.

Indicator: Adult Diabetes Prevalence
dataSourceYear: Public Health Management Corporation (PHMC) Household Health Survey
chartComment: Percentage of adults who have been told by a doctor or other health professional that they have or have had diabetes. Excludes respondents with a history of gestational diabetes only.
Central: Two years of Household Health Survey data (2012 and 2014/15) were combined to provide more reliable estimates by planning district, therefore these numbers are not directly comparable with previous estimates.

Indicator: New HIV Diagnoses per 100,000 People
dataSourceYear: HIV Surveillance Data, AIDS Activities Coordinating Office, Philadelphia Department of Public Health
chartComment: Rate of new HIV diagnoses per 100,000 population.

Indicator: New HIV Diagnoses From Male-to-Male Sexual Contact
dataSourceYear: HIV Surveillance Data, AIDS Activities Coordinating Office, Philadelphia Department of Public Health
chartComment: Percentage of new HIV diagnoses from male-to-male sexual contact.

Indicator: New HIV Diagnoses From Heterosexual Contact
dataSourceYear: HIV Surveillance Data, AIDS Activities Coordinating Office, Philadelphia Department of Public Health
chartComment: Percentage of new HIV diagnoses from heterosexual contact.

Indicator: New HIV Diagnoses From Injection Drug Use
dataSourceYear: HIV Surveillance Data, AIDS Activities Coordinating Office, Philadelphia Department of Public Health
chartComment: Percentage of new HIV diagnoses from injection drug use.

Indicator: New HIV Diagnoses From "Other" Transmission Category
dataSourceYear: HIV Surveillance Data, AIDS Activities Coordinating Office, Philadelphia Department of Public Health
chartComment: Percentage of new HIV diagnoses from "other" transmission category.

Indicator: Retention in HIV/AIDS Care
dataSourceYear: HIV Surveillance Data, AIDS Activities Coordinating Office, Philadelphia Department of Public Health
chartComment: Percentage of persons living with diagnosed HIV having had 2 or more CD4 or viral load test results, at least 3 months apart, during a 12 month period.
Central: The data displayed for North Delaware includes persons who were diagnosed or received treatment in the Philadelphia Prison System. Inclusion of these individuals may artificially inflate HIV prevalence resulting in artificially lowered HIV retention rates.

Indicator: Viral Suppression
dataSourceYear: HIV Surveillance Data, AIDS Activities Coordinating Office, Philadelphia Department of Public Health
chartComment: Percentage of persons diagnosed living with HIV, who were alive at year end and had a viral load < 200 at most recent test. Persons diagnosed living with HIV whose viral load was not assessed were considered unsuppressed.
Central: The data displayed for North Delaware includes persons who were diagnosed or received treatment in the Philadelphia Prison System. Inclusion of these individuals may artificially inflate HIV prevalence resulting in artificially lowered HIV viral suppression rates.

Indicator: Teen Births per 1,000 Teens, 15-19 Years of Age
dataSourceYear: Vital Statistics for Philadelphia, Pennsylvania Department of Health
chartComment: Birth rate per 1,000 teen girls age 15-19 years.

Indicator: Teen Chlamydia Rate per 100,000 Teens, 15-19 Years of Age
dataSourceYear: Division of Disease Control, Philadelphia Department of Public Health
chartComment: Diagnosed chlamydia infection rate per 100,000 teens age 15-19 years.

Indicator: Teen Gonorrhea rate per 100,000 Teens, 15-19 Years of Age
dataSourceYear: Division of Disease Control, Philadelphia Department of Public Health
chartComment: Diagnosed gonorrhea infection rate per 100,000 teens age 15-19 years.

Indicator: Infant Mortality Rate per 1,000 Live Births
dataSourceYear: Vital Statistics for Philadelphia, Pennsylvania Department of Health
chartComment: Mortality rate per 1,000 live-born infants under one year of age.

Indicator: Low Birth Weight Births
dataSourceYear: Vital Statistics for Philadelphia, Pennsylvania Department of Health
chartComment: Percentage of live-born infants weighing less than 2,500 grams - or 5 pounds 8 ounces - at birth.
Central: The methods for calculating low birth weights have been updated since prior reports.

Indicator: Late or No Prenatal Care
dataSourceYear: Vital Statistics for Philadelphia, Pennsylvania Department of Health
chartComment: Percentage of women who received prenatal care either in the third trimester or not at all, out of all women for whom the timing of prenatal care is known.

Indicator: Breastfeeding Initiation
dataSourceYear: Vital Statistics for Philadelphia, Pennsylvania Department of Health
chartComment: Percentage of women initiating breastfeeding before hospital discharge, out of all women for whom breastfeeding status is known.
Central: The methods for calculating breastfeeding initiation have been updated since prior reports.

Indicator: Children Up to Date on Immunizations, 19-35 Months of Age
dataSourceYear: Division of Disease Control, Philadelphia Department of Public Health
chartComment: Percentage of children, age 19-35 months, who have completed the recommended vaccination schedule 4:3:1:3 (DTaP : IPV : MMR : Hib).

Indicator: Newly Identified Elevated Blood Lead Levels (5-9 mcg/dL) in Children, < 6 Years of Age
dataSourceYear: Pennsylvania's National Electronic Disease Surveillance System (PA-NEDSS), as reported by Environmental Health Services, Philadelphia Department of Public Health
chartComment: Percentage of children, 0-5 years old, with newly identified blood lead levels (BLLs) from 5-9 mcg/dL using any blood specimens for screening.

Indicator: Newly Identified Elevated Blood Lead Levels (10+ mcg/dL) in Children, < 6 Years of Age
dataSourceYear: Pennsylvania's National Electronic Disease Surveillance System (PA-NEDSS), as reported by Environmental Health Services, Philadelphia Department of Public Health
chartComment: Percentage of children, 0-5 years old, with newly identified blood lead levels (BLLs) at or above 10 mcg/dL using any blood specimens for screening.

Indicator: Pedestrian and Bicycle Crashes Involving Children per 100,000 Children, < 18 Years of Age
dataSourceYear: Pennsylvania Department of Transportation
chartComment: Rate of child-involved pedestrian and bicyclist crashes involving motor vehicles per 100,000 children under 18.
Central: The methods for calculating  pedestrian and bicycle crashes per 100,000 children have been updated since prior reports and are not comparable to previous years.

Indicator: Child Mortality Rate per 100,000 Children, < 18 Years of Age
dataSourceYear: Vital Statistics for Philadelphia, Pennsylvania Department of Health
chartComment: Age-adjusted mortality rate per 100,000 children under 18 years of age.
Central: See PDPH Vital Statistics Reports for causes of death by age: http://www.phila.gov/health/commissioner/VitalStatistics.html

Indicator: Adults Without Insurance, 18-64 Years of Age
dataSourceYear: Public Health Management Corporation (PHMC) Household Health Survey
chartComment: Percentage of adults, age 18-64 years, reporting no source of insurance.

Indicator: Adults Covered by Medicaid, 18-64 Years of Age
dataSourceYear: Public Health Management Corporation (PHMC) Household Health Survey
chartComment: Percentage of adults, age 18-64 years, reporting insurance coverage through Medicaid, Medical Assistance (M.A.), HealthChoices, or Access Card.

Indicator: Adults Forgoing Care Due to Cost, 18-64 Years of Age
dataSourceYear: Public Health Management Corporation (PHMC) Household Health Survey
chartComment: Percentage of adults, age 18-64 years, answering "yes" to the question, "In the past year, has there been any time when you were sick or injured AND did not seek health care because of the cost?"
Central: Two years of Household Health Survey data (2012 and 2014/15) were combined to provide more reliable estimates by planning district, therefore these numbers are not directly comparable with previous estimates.

Indicator: Population per Primary Care Physician
dataSourceYear: American Medical Association Masterfiles via the Health Resources and Services Administration Primary Care Service Area Project, 2010
chartComment: Number of people per primary care physician

Indicator: Population per Dentist
dataSourceYear: American Medical Association Masterfiles via the Health Resources and Services Administration Primary Care Service Area Project, 2011
chartComment: Number of people per dentist

Indicator: Cancer Mortality per 100,000 People
dataSourceYear: Vital Statistics for Philadelphia, Pennsylvania Department of Health
chartComment: Age-adjusted rate of cancer deaths per 100,000 persons.

Indicator: Girls Completing 3-Dose HPV Vaccine, 13-17 Years of Age
dataSourceYear: Division of Disease Control, Philadelphia Department of Public Health
chartComment: Percentage of girls, age 13-17 years, who received 3 doses of HPV vaccine out of all girls 13-17 years in the population.
Central: Data are based on local reporting of immunizations provided by clinicians, and some underreporting for adolescents may occur.

Indicator: Food Establishments in Compliance with Food Safety Regulations Upon Initial Annual Inspection
dataSourceYear: Environmental Health Services, Philadelphia Department of Public Health
chartComment: Percentage of food establishments in compliance with food safety regulations upon initial annual inspection by the Philadelphia Department of Public Health.
Central: Some establishments included in the overall compliance rate are not included in the planning district dimension due to non-permanent locations.

Indicator: Rat Complaints per 10,000 People
dataSourceYear: Environmental Health Services, Philadelphia Department of Public Health
chartComment: Rate of rat complaint calls to the Philadelphia Department of Public Health per 10,000 residents.

Indicator: Philadelphia Building Construction and Occupancy Code Violations per 1,000 Occupied Housing Units
dataSourceYear: City of Philadelphia Licenses and Inspections
chartComment: Rate of Philadelphia Building Construction and Occupancy Code violations per 1,000 occupied housing units. Violations are based on follow-up inspections to complaints filed through Philly 311.

Indicator: Homicide Mortality Rate per 100,000 People
dataSourceYear: Medical Examiner's Office, Philadelphia Department of Public Health
chartComment: Rate of homicide deaths per 100,000 persons.
Central: Data do include deaths of residents who died outside of Philadelphia.

Indicator: Firearm Homicide Rate per 100,000 People
dataSourceYear: Medical Examiner's Office, Philadelphia Department of Public Health
chartComment: Rate of intentional deaths by discharge of firearm per 100,000 persons.
Central: Data do include deaths of residents who died outside of Philadelphia.

Indicator: Suicide Mortality Rate per 100,000 People
dataSourceYear: Medical Examiner's Office, Philadelphia Department of Public Health
chartComment: Age-adjusted rate of deaths by intentional self-harm per 100,000 persons.
Central: Data do include deaths of residents who died outside of Philadelphia.

Indicator: Adults with Diagnosed Mental Health Condition
dataSourceYear: Public Health Management Corporation (PHMC) Household Health Survey
chartComment: Percentage of adults answering "yes" to the question, "Have you ever been diagnosed with any mental health condition, including clinical depression, anxiety disorder or bipolar disorder?"
Central: Two years of Household Health Survey data (2012 and 2014/15) were combined to provide more reliable estimates by planning district, therefore these numbers are not directly comparable with previous estimates.

Indicator: Opioid-Related Mortality Rate per 100,000 People
dataSourceYear: Medical Examiner's Office, Philadelphia Department of Public Health
chartComment: Rate of deaths per 100,000 persons that were determined by the medical examiner to be caused by drug/medication overdose and for which a toxicology test was positive for an opioid.
Central: Opioids include heroin, morphine, methadone, fentanyl, and all pharmaceutical opioids such as codeine, hydrocodone, and oxycodone. Data do include deaths of residents who died outside of Philadelphia.

Indicator: Low-to-no Walkable Access to Healthy Foods and High Poverty
dataSourceYear: Get Healthy Philly, Philadelphia Department of Public Health
chartComment: Percentage of population living in high-poverty areas with low-to-no walkable access to healthy foods as assessed in PDPH's [Food Access Report](http://www.phila.gov/health/pdfs/WalkableAccessHealthyFood20122014.pdf).
Central: Please note that data definitions and sources differ across dimensions for this indicator.

Indicator: Access to Nearby Parks or Outdoor Space
dataSourceYear: Public Health Management Corporation (PHMC) Household Health Survey
chartComment: Percentage of adults responding yes to the question, Is there a park or other outdoor space in your neighborhood that you’re comfortable visiting during the day?""
Central: Two years of Household Health Survey data (2012 and 2014/15) were combined to provide more reliable estimates by planning district, therefore these numbers are not directly comparable with previous estimates.

Indicator: Pedestrian and Bicycle Crashes per 100,000 People
dataSourceYear: Pennsylvania Department of Transportation
chartComment: Rate of pedestrian and bicyclist crashes involving motor vehicles per 100,000 persons.

Indicator: Adults Completing Some College, ? 25 Years of Age
dataSourceYear: US Census Bureau, American Community Survey, 5-year estimates
chartComment: Percentage of adults, 25 years or older, who completed at least some college.
Central: Please note that data years differ across dimensions for this indicator.

Indicator: Unemployment, ?16 Years of Age
dataSourceYear: US Census Bureau, American Community Survey, 5-year estimates
chartComment: Percentage of population, 16 years or older, who are unemployed but seeking work.
Central: Please note that data sources and years differ across dimensions for this indicator.

Indicator: Philadelphians Living in Poverty
dataSourceYear: US Census Bureau, American Community Survey, 5-year estimates
chartComment: Percentage of population with an income below 100% of the federal poverty level (FPL).
Central: In 2014, the FPL was equivalent to a yearly income of no more than $11,670 for an individual, or $23,850 for a family of 4. Please note that data years differ across dimensions for this indicator.

Indicator: Children Living in Poverty, < 18 Years of Age
dataSourceYear: US Census Bureau, American Community Survey, 5-year estimates
chartComment: Percentage of children under 18 with a family income below 100% of the federal poverty level (FPL).
Central: In 2014, the FPL was equivalent to a yearly income of no more than $11,670 for an individual, or $23,850 for a family of 4. Please note that data years differ across dimensions for this indicator.

Indicator: Children in Single-Parent Households, < 18 Years of Age
dataSourceYear: US Census Bureau, American Community Survey, 5-year estimates
chartComment: Percentage of all children in family households that live in a household headed by a single parent (male or female head of household with no spouse present).

Indicator: Social Capital
dataSourceYear: Public Health Management Corporation (PHMC) Household Health Survey
chartComment: Percentage of adults reporting "yes" to, "Have people in your neighborhood ever worked together to improve the neighborhood? For example, through a neighborhood watch, creating a community garden, building a community playground, or participating in a block party."

Indicator: Housing-Cost Burden for Renters
dataSourceYear: US Census Bureau, American Community Survey, 5-year estimates
chartComment: Percentage of the household population who pays 30% or more of their income for rental housing.
Central: According to the US Department of Housing and Urban Development (HUD), families who pay more than 30% of their income for housing are considered cost burdened and may have difficulty affording necessities such as food, clothing, transportation, and medical care.

Indicator: Severe Housing-Cost Burden for Renters
dataSourceYear: US Census Bureau, American Community Survey, 5-year estimates
chartComment: Percentage of the household population who pays 50% or more of their income for rental housing.
Central: According to the US Department of Housing and Urban Development (HUD), families who pay more than 30% of their income for housing are considered cost burdened and may have difficulty affording necessities such as food, clothing, transportation, and medical care.
